tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses is still speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: When Yahweh your God cuts off the nations
tn.text: Yahweh destroying the people who live in Canaan is spoken of as if he were cutting them off, as one would cut a piece of cloth or cut a branch from a tree. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: the nations
tn.text: This represents the people groups that live in Canaan. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: those whose land Yahweh your God is giving you
tn.text: "those nations who were living in the land that Yahweh your God is giving you"

tn.ref: come after them
tn.text: "take the land from those nations" or "possess the land after those nations are gone"

tn.ref: select three cities
tn.text: "choose 3 cities" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: You must build a road
tn.text: They were to build roads so that it would be easy for people to travel to these cities. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: divide the borders of your land into three parts
tn.text: It is implied that one of the cities they choose must be in each part of the land. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the land that Yahweh your God is causing you to inherit
tn.text: Yahweh giving the land to the people of Israel is spoken of as if the people are inheriting the land. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: This is the law
tn.text: "These are the instructions" or "These are the directions"

tn.ref: for the one who kills another
tn.text: The word "person" is understood. AT: "for a person who kills another person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: and who flees there
tn.text: "and who escapes to one of these cities" or "and who runs to one of these cities"

tn.ref: to live
tn.text: "to save his own life." The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "so the family of the man who died does not kill him to get revenge" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: whoever kills his neighbor unawares
tn.text: Here "neighbor" means any person in general. AT: "any person who kills another person by accident"

tn.ref: and did not previously hate him
tn.text: "but did not hate his neighbor before he killed him." This implies there was no cause for him to kill his neighbor purposely. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: as when a man goes into the forest ... to cut wood
tn.text: The author gives a hypothetical situation where a person accidentally kills another person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_hypo]])

tn.ref: the head slips from the shaft
tn.text: The iron part of the ax comes off the handle.

tn.ref: strikes his neighbor so that he dies
tn.text: This means the head of the ax hits and kills the neighbor.

tn.ref: to one of these cities and live
tn.text: "to one of these cities to save his own life." It is implied that the family of the dead man may try to get revenge. The man who killed him can flee to one of these cities, and the people there would protect him. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses is still speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: the avenger of blood
tn.text: Here "blood" represents the person who was killed. An "avenger of blood" is a close relative of the person who was killed. This relative is responsible for punishing the murderer. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the one who took a life
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "the one who killed the other person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: in the heat of his anger
tn.text: Someone being very angry is spoken of as if anger were something that could become hot. AT: "and being very angry" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: strike him and kill him
tn.text: "And the blood avenger strikes and kills the one who had killed the other person"

tn.ref: though that man did not deserve to die, since he had not hated his neighbor in the past
tn.text: "though that man did not deserve to die since he accidentally killed the other person and was not his enemy, and he had not planned to hurt the man"

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses is still speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: enlarges your borders
tn.text: "gives you more land to possess"

tn.ref: as he has sworn to your ancestors to do
tn.text: "like he promised your ancestors that he would do"

tn.ref: if you keep all these commandments to do them
tn.text: "if you obey all these commandments"

tn.ref: to always walk in his ways
tn.text: How God wants a person to live or behave is spoken of as if it were Yahweh's way or road. A person who obeys Yahweh is spoken of as if he were walking on Yahweh's way or road. AT: "to always obey him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: then you must add three more cities for yourself
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "then you must choose three more cities for a person to escape to if he accidentally kills someone" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: besides these three
tn.text: "in addition to the three cities you already established" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: Do this so that innocent blood is not shed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Do this so that family members do not kill an innocent person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: innocent blood is not shed
tn.text: Here "blood" represents a person's life. To shed blood means to kill a person. This can be stated in active form. AT: "no one kills an innocent person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: in the midst of the land
tn.text: "in the land" or "in the territory"

tn.ref: Yahweh your God is giving you for as an inheritance
tn.text: The land that Yahweh is giving the people of Israel is spoken of as if it were an inheritance. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: so that no bloodguilt may be on you
tn.text: The people of Israel being guilty for a person dying because they did not build a city where he would be safe from the "blood avenger" is spoken of as if the guilt of his death is on them. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: bloodguilt
tn.text: Here "blood" represents a life and "bloodguilt" refers to the guilt someone has for killing an innocent person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: may be on you
tn.text: This means that if a family member kills an innocent person, then all the people of Israel will be guilty for letting that happen.

tn.ref: his neighbor
tn.text: Here "neighbor" means any person in general.

tn.ref: lies in wait for him
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "hides and waits in order to kill him" or "plans to kill him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: rises up against him
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "attacks him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: and mortally wounds him so that he dies
tn.text: "and hurts him so that he dies" or "and kills him"

tn.ref: must send and bring him back from there
tn.text: "must send someone to get him and bring him back from the city that he escaped to"

tn.ref: turn him over
tn.text: This is an idiom. AT: "give him over" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: into the hand of the responsible relative
tn.text: Here "the hand" represents the authority of someone. AT: "to the authority of the responsible relative" or "to the responsible relative" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: the responsible relative
tn.text: This is the relative of the person who was killed. This relative is responsible for punishing the murderer.

tn.ref: he may die
tn.text: "the murderer may die" or "the responsible relative may execute the murderer"

tn.ref: Your eye must not pity him
tn.text: Here "your eye" represents the whole person. AT: "Do not show him mercy" or "Do not feel sorry for him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: you must eradicate the bloodguilt from Israel
tn.text: Here "bloodguilt" represents the guilt for murdering an innocent person. AT: "you must execute the murderer so that the people of Israel will not be guilty for the death of an innocent person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: from Israel
tn.text: Here "Israel" refers to the people of Israel. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses is still speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: You must not remove your neighbor's landmark
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "You must not take land away from your neighbor by moving the markers on the borders of his land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: they set in place
tn.text: "that your ancestors placed"

tn.ref: a long time ago
tn.text: Moses means that when the people have lived in the land for a long time, they should not move the borders that their ancestors made when they first took the land.

tn.ref: in your inheritance that you will inherit, in the land that Yahweh your God is giving you to possess
tn.text: Yahweh giving the land to the people of Israel is spoken of as if they were inheriting the land. AT: "in the land that Yahweh your God is giving to you to possess" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses is still speaking to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: One sole witness
tn.text: "A single witness" or "Only one witness"

tn.ref: must not rise up against a man
tn.text: Here "rise up" means to stand up in court and speak against someone to a judge. AT: "must not speak to the judges about something bad that a man did" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: in any matter that he sins
tn.text: "anytime that a man does something bad"

tn.ref: at the mouth of two witnesses, or at the mouth of three witnesses
tn.text: Here "mouth" represents what the witnesses say. It is implied that there must be at least two or three witnesses. AT: "at the testimony of at least two or three people" or "based on what at least two or three people say happened" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: must any matter be confirmed
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "will you confirm that the man is guilty" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])

tn.ref: Suppose that
tn.text: "When" or "If"

tn.ref: an unrighteous witness
tn.text: "a witness who intends to harm someone else"

tn.ref: rises up against any man to testify against him of wrongdoing
tn.text: Here "rise up" means to stand up in court and speak against someone to a judge.  AT: "tells the judge that a man sinned in order to get the man in trouble" or "tells the judge that a man sinned, so the judge will punish him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: General Information:
tn.text: Moses continues to speak to the people of Israel.

tn.ref: the ones between whom the controversy exists
tn.text: "the ones who disagree with one another"

tn.ref: must stand before Yahweh, before the priests and the judges
tn.text: This means the two persons must go to the sanctuary where Yahweh's presence dwells. At the sanctuary are priests and judges who have the authority to make legal decisions for Yahweh. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: stand before Yahweh, before the priests and the judges
tn.text: The phrase "stand before" is an idiom. It means to go to someone with authority and let him make a legal decision about a matter. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])

tn.ref: The judges must make diligent inquiries
tn.text: "The judges must work very hard to determine what happened"

tn.ref: then must you do to him, as he had wished to do to his brother
tn.text: "then you must punish the false witness in the same way as he wanted you to punish the other man"

tn.ref: you will remove the evil from among you
tn.text: The abstract noun "the evil" can be stated as an adjective. AT: "by punishing the false witness, you will stop this evil practice within your nation" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_abstractnouns]])

tn.ref: Then those who remain
tn.text: "When you punish the false witness, the rest of the people"

tn.ref: will hear and fear
tn.text: The full meaning of this statement can be made explicit. AT: "will hear about the punishment and be afraid of getting punished" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: commit no longer any such evil
tn.text: "never again do something evil like that"

tn.ref: Your eyes must not pity
tn.text: Here "eyes" refer to the whole person. AT: "You must not pity him" or "You must not show him mercy" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]])

tn.ref: life will pay for life ... foot for foot
tn.text: Here the phrases are shortened because the meaning is understood. It means the people must punish a person in the same way that he harmed another person. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])
